abstract: Houdini and his art unshackles the imagination in a retrospective at San Francisco's Contemporary Jewish Museum.
snippet: Houdini and his art unshackles the imagination in a retrospective at San Francisco's Contemporary Jewish Museum.
lead_paragraph: When it comes to unshackling the imagination, there's no artist like an escape artist. And Harry Houdini is getting his due with "Houdini: Art and Magic," the first major retrospective devoted to his life and work, at San Francisco's Contemporary Jewish Museum. The son of a rabbi, Houdini (born Ehrich Weiss) captured the world's attention by freeing himself from any number of impossible binds from straitjackets to locked boxes submerged in frigid waters.
